about_the_game:
Atonia: Netorare Annals is a kinetic novel with two chapters of the Atonia Series. The main focus of this series is unavoidable Netorare, which aims at evoking intense sexual jealousy in the player. There are many explicit intimacy scenes between several characters, and the player will be able experience it in two different ways; by learning about the truth or remaining oblivious. This kinetic novel contains upgraded renders, new scenes, and general updates to the original two chapters of the Atonia Series (Atonia Blues and Atonia: Church of Holy Ascension). The play time of this kinetic novel is about 2 hours, with 410 total renders.

Atonia is a land in a bleak future. A man and his wife have narrowly escaped the catastrophic raiding and pillaging of their beloved settlement. They must now find a safe place to live. Along the way, they will meet a mysterious man who seems to have ulterior motives. At the same time, another couple have decided to migrate to a bigger and safer city to start a family. The city is deeply religious, and catches the young couple off guard. What ensues will bring them both spiraling down an endless abyss...

RICH WORLD


Atonia has a rich history. There are many clues that explain how the world came to be this way.

REMAIN OBLIVIOUS?


The player may remain oblivious to all the things happening to his love interest... But the truth may be too tempting.

BRUTALLY EMOTIONAL


Even the most stoic players may experience intense jealousy (Netorare/NTR). Those who enjoy sexual jealousy, rejoice!

content_descriptors.notes:
There are many consensual sexual scenes in this game. Player discretion is advised.

The Atonia kinetic novel series will induce jealousy, angst, and other strong emotions. The player will also feel a high degree of perceived injustice and powerlessness, meaning that these kinetic novels are no-win situations. This is intentional and unavoidable. If you do not like these types of games, or have never tried any of my other games before, the Atonia series should be avoided.
